nodes.title: Game Updates
nodes.category_description: The definitive source on all updates coming to the game.

articles.title: Patch 12.3 notes
articles.description: Season 2022 is in bloom! Catch up on the latest champion balances, Ahri's refresh, fighter item changes, and more.

articles.title: Patch 12.2 notes
articles.description: Zip, zap, and zoom with Zeri and celebrate the Lunar New Year with patch 12.2!

articles.title: Patch 12.1 notes
articles.description: Welcome to Season 2022!

articles.title: Patch 11.24 notes
articles.description: The last patch of the year warrants a green tie, Debonair affair.

articles.title: Patch 11.23 notes
articles.description: Dive deep into Preseason 2022 and deeper Into the Arcane!

articles.title: Patch 11.22 notes
articles.description: The end of the season draws near. Worlds finals, Arcane, Victorious, and more!

articles.title: Patch 11.21 notes
articles.description: Worlds is in the air! Soar along with the hype with Dragonmancers, buffs, and nerfs galore!

articles.title: Patch 11.20 notes
articles.description: A handful of tricks and treats to keep things brewing smoothly for the rest of the season.

articles.title: Patch 11.19 notes
articles.description: Part 2 of Worlds balances, the return of URF, and an emo Yordle.

articles.title: Patch 11.18 notes
articles.description: Part 1 of 2 for "Worlds-changing" adjustments.

articles.title: Patch 11.17 notes
articles.description: It’s a bird… It’s a plane… It’s patch 11.17! Some champion fine-tuning and a crime city nightmare.

articles.title: Patch 11.16 notes
articles.description: This patch has adjustments to two ladies: one of spirit, and another of harmony.

articles.title: Patch 11.15 notes
articles.description: A simpler patch with buffs to old friends! (Blitz, is that you?)

articles.title: Patch 11.14 notes
articles.description: Adjustments to a catfish, a dancer, a fawn, and a doctor.

articles.title: Patch 11.13 notes
articles.description: Tahm gets fresh new kicks, mobility gets taken down a few ticks, and there’s discounted mana Mythics!

articles.title: Patch 11.12 notes
articles.description: Mundo’s all doctored up and ready to zap some hearts in 11.12!

articles.title: Patch 11.11 notes
articles.description: Reeling back some junglers and reeling out others...

articles.title: Patch 11.10 notes
articles.description: In the jungle, the mighty jungle...

articles.title: Patch 11.9 notes
articles.description: Come on ‘round to the Midseason shakedown!

articles.title: Patch 11.8 notes
articles.description: A seamstress and a shined up armadillo take on 11.8!

articles.title: Patch 11.7 notes
articles.description: Put on some space tunes, it’s time to groove with friends from the Freljord to the Void!

articles.title: Patch 11.6 notes
articles.description: Xin Zhao, healing, and more!

articles.title: Patch 11.5 notes
articles.description: This patch might just be the bee's knees!

articles.title: Patch 11.4 notes
articles.description: We’ve got changes for champs, items, jungle camps...

articles.title: Patch 11.3 notes
articles.description: Who needs chocolates when you’ve got balance changes and crystal roses?

articles.title: Patch 11.2 notes
articles.description: Balance changes and Viego are a go!

articles.title: Patch 11.1 notes
articles.description: New year, new patch, same ol’ balancing!

articles.title: Patch 10.25 notes
articles.description: We’re just Relly glad to see you before the end of the year!

articles.title: Patch 10.24 notes
articles.description: Still catching your breath from last patch? Well, one more thing...

articles.title: Patch 10.23 notes
articles.description: It’s not a myth, Preseason is here and it’s pretty legendary...

articles.title: Patch 10.22 notes
articles.description: A pop star and some fiery champs on a hot streak!

articles.title: Patch 10.21 notes
articles.description: Pumpkin spice, a light patch, and everything nice

articles.title: Patch 10.20 notes
articles.description: A slew of changes and dragon skins.

articles.title: Patch 10.19 notes
articles.description: Swinging in with a gunslinging gal and some quick touch-ups for Worlds.

articles.title: Patch 10.18 notes
articles.description: A plethora of League Client updates, One For All's return, and Ahri's flightiness is amped up to 10.

articles.title: Patch 10.17 notes
articles.description: Small balance changes, including our baby girl.

articles.title: Patch 10.16 notes
articles.description: A little razzle here, a little dazzle there...we’re shaking the meta up this patch!

articles.title: Patch 10.15 notes
articles.description: The blossoming of spirits, dreams, and a frolicking fawn...

articles.title: Patch 10.14 notes
articles.description: Bringing on more spirit, shadows, and swords.

articles.title: Patch 10.13 notes
articles.description: A couple rune changes and some love to some off-meta builds.

articles.title: Patch 10.12 notes
articles.description: Updated runes, elemental terrain, and...ghost!

articles.title: Patch 10.11 notes
articles.description: A bear, and a bear hug to our marksmen...

articles.title: Patch 10.10 notes
articles.description: URF is back! And some tweaks to a little girl, a beaming lady, and a master of cards.

articles.title: Patch 10.9 notes
articles.description: A buffed bird, ice queen, and blade walk into a bar...

articles.title: Patch 10.8 Notes
articles.description: The Patch 10.8 Notes are here.

articles.title: Patch 10.7 notes
articles.description: Beware the sounding of the crows… Fiddlesticks has returned.

articles.title: Patch 10.6 notes
articles.description: Autofill balance adjustments and a large update to Wukong.

articles.title: Patch 10.5 notes
articles.description: Larger adjustments to top lane influence and Eternals are live.

articles.title: Patch 10.4 Notes
articles.description: You get a jungler, and you get a jungler, and you get a jungler!

articles.title: Patch 10.3 notes
articles.description: EXP and gold changes to Jungle monsters and bigger work for Akali and Yuumi.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 12.3  notes
articles.description: Patch 12.3 is a smaller patch that focuses on Augment balancing before our mid-set, Neon Nights, in patch 12.4.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 12.2  notes
articles.description: The Gifts of the Golden Lantern Event comes with patch 12.2 allowing you to give, and receive gifts to celebrate Lunar Legend Festival!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 12.1  notes
articles.description: Patch 12.1 brings lighter balance changes to traits and champs in addition to Augment tune ups!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.24 notes
articles.description: Patch 11.24 brings adjustments to trait tied Augments, a rework for Chemtech, and balance changes as well!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.23 notes
articles.description: Patch 11.23 is our first patch of the new set, Gizmos & Gadgets!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.22 notes
articles.description: It's here! TFT: Gizmos & Gadgets has arrived with patch 11.22, bringing us all new champions, traits, Tacticians and more!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.21 notes
articles.description: Patch 11.21 is our last patch before the new set, Gizmos & Gadgets! Good luck hitting your ranked goals!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.20 notes
articles.description: TFT patch 11.20 is our first patch after Worlds that continues to tighten the balance, but also adds a couple fun twists to make for more memorable experiences as we close out the set.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.19 notes
articles.description: 11.19 continues to tighten the balance, while buffing underpowered and underplayed comps.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.18 notes
articles.description: TFT patch 11.18 brings a number of balance adjustments, nerfs to the Revenant frontline, and buffs to a few 3 star 4-costs.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.17 notes
articles.description: Patch 11.17 adjusts Sentinels and Spellweavers, empowers struggling 4 and 5-cost carries, and more.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.16 notes
articles.description: TFT patch 11.16 is our first patch of Dawn of Heroes where we’ll be making changes to Legionnaire, keeping the Radiant items in equilibrium, and lending a hand to some of the slightly underpowered champions and traits.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.15 notes
articles.description: The Dawn of Heroes has begun! Patch 11.15 brings a new quest, and a bright future in the mid-set update, starring new champions, mechanics, traits, and more!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.14 notes
articles.description: Patch 11.14 brings balance tweaks and interface changes as the last patch before Dawn of Heroes!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.13 notes
articles.description: TFT patch 11.13 notes bring mini-reworks to three champs, more consistency in the Armory, and some general balance updates.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.12 notes
articles.description: Patch 11.12 delivers new win conditions and mechanic updates that’ll keep things fresh and fun.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.11 notes
articles.description: TFT patch 11.11 brings balance changes, system changes, UI/UX improvements and more.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.10 notes
articles.description: TFT patch 11.10 increases strategic diversity with new win conditions and lots of item changes.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.9 notes
articles.description: TFT: Reckoning has arrived, bringing all new Champions, Traits, Little Legends and more!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.8 notes
articles.description: In TFT patch 11.8 we conclude the Festival of Beasts with a bang before the release of TFT: Reckoning.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.7 notes
articles.description: There are only two patches left before the next set, Reckoning, so it’s time to turn this party up with a patch full of fresh, fun, and fantastic four-cost win conditions.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.6 notes
articles.description: 11.6 puts the focus on balance nudges to maintain our balanced game state.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.5 notes
articles.description: Patch 11.5 brings a slew of item changes, a debuff system overhaul, and a couple balance tweaks.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.4 notes
articles.description: TFT Patch 11.4 brings a mini-rework to the Chosen system along with more balance changes to shake things up in the Festival.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.3 notes
articles.description: Following the start of the Festival of Beasts, patch 11.3 will be continuing the celebration with balance changes galore!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.2 notes
articles.description: Welcome to the Festival of Beasts! Patch 11.2 brings all new traits, champions, and a new set mechanic.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 11.1 notes
articles.description: General balancing before the start of the Festival!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.25 notes
articles.description: Buffs to struggling traits in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.24 notes
articles.description: Systems changes shakeup the meta in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.23 notes
articles.description: KDA Little Legends and Xin Zhao reworked in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.22 notes
articles.description: Keepers and Cultists buffed in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.21 notes
articles.description: Ranked Rewards and Reroll changes headline TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.20 notes
articles.description: Fates' first update brings combat recap improvements and a host of buffs for underpowered champions!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.19 notes
articles.description: Teamfight Tactics: Fates is here!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.18 notes
articles.description: TFT Galaxies' Grand Finale!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.17 notes
articles.description: A new Galaxy brings Spatulas for everyone in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.16 notes
articles.description: Item Upgrades and a Salvage World in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.15 notes
articles.description: Dark Star nerfs and Plunder Planets in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.14 notes
articles.description: Urgot and Star Guardian changes, Celestial buffs and a new Galaxy all in TFT's crowded update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.13 notes
articles.description: Buffed up Battlecasts and a whole new Galaxy in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.12 notes
articles.description: Galaxies II is here with a spaceship full of new Champions and Traits, a new ranked stage, new Little Legends, and a new Pass!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.11 notes
articles.description: Littler Legends in TFT's last patch before the Mid-Set Update!

articles.title: TFT patch 10.10 notes
articles.description: Arm up with a new Galaxy in TFT's latest update!

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.9 notes
articles.description: Prepare for a new look Chrono and more Galaxies in TFT's latest update.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.8 notes
articles.description: TFT's latest update brings even moar Galaxies along with a host of buffs to some underplayed champions and traits.

articles.title: TFT patch 10.7 notes
articles.description: TFT's latest update brings Galaxies to your Galaxies so you can galaxy while you galaxy.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.6 notes
articles.description: Welcome to the stars! Teamfight Tactics: Galaxies is here.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.5 notes
articles.description: The Last Rise of the Elements Update.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.4 notes
articles.description: Ice, ice baby. Glacial gets some adjustments.

articles.title: Teamfight Tactics patch 10.3 notes
articles.description: Check out the wide variety of buffs and carousel changes in Teamfight Tactics' latest update.

articles.title: Sett, the Boss | New Champion Spotlight
articles.description: Sett fights with the strength of his fists, knocking foes down on his way to the top. With his signature punches and an attitude to kill, this half-vastayan, half-Noxian boss takes matters into his own two hands.

messages.abilities-spells-and-items.title: Abilities, Spells & Items
messages.abilities.description: Most champions have a unique kit made up of five abilities: a [Passive](tooltip:passive-ability), three [Basics](tooltip:basic-abilities), and an [Ultimate](tooltip:ultimate-ability). These abilities are mapped to the Q, W, E, and R keys.
messages.abilities.title: Abilities
messages.about-the-game.title: About The Game
messages.about.title: About
messages.all.title: All
messages.assassins.description: Assassins are highly mobile melee combatants who can quickly take down opponents. Their low defenses mean they must execute their kills with precision or risk being shut down themselves.
messages.assassins.title: Assassins
messages.available-skins.title: Available Skins
messages.basic-abilities.description: Your champion’s basic abilities are mapped to the Q, W, and E keys and can be leveled up throughout the course of the game. They sometimes cost mana to cast or have a cooldown period.
messages.basic-abilities.title: Basic abilities

messages.champion-list.title: Champion List
messages.champion-mastery.title: Champion Mastery
messages.champion-role.title: Role
messages.champion-skins.title: Champion Skins
messages.champion.ahri.description: Ahri outfoxes her enemies with dashes and bursts of movement speed. Her entrancing magic draws foes in, leaving them overextended and vulnerable.
messages.champion.ahri.name: Ahri
messages.champion.ahri.title: The Nine-Tailed Fox
messages.champion.akali.name: Akali
messages.champion.akali.title: The Rogue Assassin
messages.champion.brand.description: Brand incinerates enemies with combustible combos. His scorches burn enemies over time and he ignites inferno-sized flares for deadly damage.
messages.champion.brand.name: Brand
messages.champion.brand.title: The Burning Vengeance
messages.champion.braum.name: Braum
messages.champion.braum.title: The Heart of The Freljord
messages.champion.chogath.name: Cho’Gath
messages.champion.chogath.title: The Terror of the Void
messages.champion.darius.description: Darius decimates his enemies with increasing brutality. He slashes through multiple foes at once, then mercilessly executes them one after another.
messages.champion.darius.name: Darius
messages.champion.darius.title: The Hand of Noxus
messages.champion.ekko.description: Ekko tampers with time to skirmish around foes. He can rewind to a previous location to escape, or hit reverse on the way out to re-engage with a bang.
messages.champion.ekko.name: Ekko
messages.champion.ekko.title: The Boy Who Shattered Time
messages.champion.garen.description: Garen strikes down scores of foes by spinning around with his huge sword. He dispenses justice by calling down an almighty blade to execute enemies.
messages.champion.garen.name: Garen
messages.champion.garen.title: The Might of Demacia
messages.champion.jinx.name: Jinx
messages.champion.jinx.title: The Loose Cannon
messages.champion.leona.name: Leona
messages.champion.leona.title: The Radiant Dawn
messages.champion.lux.description: Lux lights up foes from afar, binding targets in place to line up brilliant attacks. Her burst of spells ends with the blast from her giant laser beam.
messages.champion.lux.name: Lux
messages.champion.lux.title: The Lady of Luminosity
messages.champion.masteryi.description: Master Yi strikes swiftly and relentlessly. He warps into the middle of a fight to slash his target or to nimbly evade an enemy counterattack.
messages.champion.masteryi.name: Master Yi
messages.champion.masteryi.title: The Wuju Bladesman
messages.champion.missfortune.description: Miss Fortune sinks her enemies with attacks that hit like cannonballs. She can fire off a single shot or unload a barrage of bullets in a teamfight.
messages.champion.missfortune.name: Miss Fortune
messages.champion.missfortune.title: The Bounty Hunter
messages.champion.sona.description: Sona performs an enchanting symphony, changing melodies to enhance allies and control enemies. Her sweeping crescendo leaves the enemy team stunned.
messages.champion.sona.name: Sona
messages.champion.sona.title: Maven of the Strings
messages.champion.thresh.name: Thresh
messages.champion.thresh.title: The Chain Warden
messages.champion.tristana.description: Tristana’s explosive charges take down towers in record time. She rocket launches in and out of combat, resetting every time she explodes an enemy.
messages.champion.tristana.name: Tristana
messages.champion.tristana.title: The Yordle Gunner
messages.champion.warwick.name: Warwick
messages.champion.warwick.title: The Uncaged Wrath of Zaun
messages.champion.yasuo.name: Yasuo
messages.champion.yasuo.title: The Unforgiven
messages.champions.title: Champions
messages.cloud-drake.description: Cloud Drake grants the slayer’s team increased cooldown reduction for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Cloud Drake, new movement zones appear in the jungle that boost your movement speed.
messages.cloud-drake.title: Cloud Drake
messages.day-1.title: Day 1
messages.day-2.title: Day 2

messages.earn-experience.title: Earn Experience
messages.earn-gold.title: Earn Gold
messages.elder-dragon.description: Elder Dragon spawns once three of the same Elemental Drake are slain. When Elder Dragon is slain, it grants the slayer’s team true damage burn over time and the ability to instantly kill opponents below a certain health level upon dealing damage.
messages.elder-dragon.title: Elder Dragon
messages.esports-and-more.title: Esports and More
messages.facebook.title: Facebook
messages.featured-news.title: Featured
messages.fighters.description: Fighters are short-ranged combatants who excel at both dealing and surviving damage. They are weak against champions who excel at crowd control, fighting from a long range, and mobility.
messages.fighters.title: Fighters
messages.flash.description: Flash instantly blinks your champion a short distance when activated. This can help you dodge deadly attacks or close the gap when chasing a kill.
messages.flash.title: Flash
messages.fog-of-war.description: The Fog of War covers the entire map, limiting your team’s field of vision. Things like team turrets, minions, and wards are crucial to maintaining sight.
messages.fog-of-war.title: Fog of War
messages.fountain.description: The Fountain is where champions first spawn, respawn after dying, and appear after recalling to base. This area also protects the home team by dealing massive damage to any opponents who approach.
messages.fountain.title: Fountain
messages.gallery.title: Gallery
messages.game-mode.aram.description: Battle across an icy bridge as your team of random champions charge toward the enemy Nexus in this chaotically fun 5v5 game mode.
messages.game-mode.aram.headline: All Random, All Mid
messages.game-mode.aram.name: ARAM
messages.game-mode.summoners-rift.description: Clear your lane, dive into epic 5v5 team fights, and destroy the enemy nexus before they destroy yours.
messages.game-mode.summoners-rift.headline: The most popular game mode
messages.game-mode.summoners-rift.name: Summoner’s Rift
messages.game-mode.team-fight-tactics.description: Assemble a squad of champions that battle on your behalf. Outlast all seven of your opponents and become the last person standing.
messages.game-mode.team-fight-tactics.headline: A free-for-all war for supremacy
messages.game-mode.team-fight-tactics.name: Teamfight Tactics
messages.game-modes.title: Game Modes
messages.goal.title: Goal
messages.highlights.title: Highlights
messages.how-to-play.title: How To Play
messages.ignite.description: Ignite deals true damage over time to enemy champions.
messages.ignite.title: Ignite
messages.infernal-drake.description: Infernal Drake grants the slayer’s team increased attack damage or ability power and increased armor or magic penetration for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Infernal Drake, new pathways appear in the jungle.
messages.infernal-drake.title: Infernal Drake
messages.instagram.title: Instagram
messages.items.description: Items enhance your champion’s performance, like granting faster movement, improved damage, and reduced ability cooldowns. Unlike [Trinkets](tooltip:trinkets), they require gold to purchase.
messages.items.title: Items
messages.lane-positions.title: Lane Positions
messages.latest-news.title: Latest News
messages.league-of-legends.title: League of Legends
messages.level-1.title: Level 1
messages.level-10.title: Level 10
messages.level-2.title: Level 2

messages.level-7.title: Level 7

messages.level-9.title: Level 9
messages.linkedin.title: LinkedIn
messages.mages.description: Mages are typically long-range combatants who excel at crowd control, area of effect damage, and burst damage. They are vulnerable to highly mobile champions and those who can lock them down.
messages.mages.title: Mages
messages.marksmen.description: Marksmen are ranged combatants, relying on their attack speed to deal massive damage as they scale in game. They are vulnerable to burst damage and tend to be weaker in early game.
messages.marksmen.title: Marksmen
messages.minions.description: Minions are battling units that advance along a lane, automatically attacking any enemy unit or structure in their path. They can be melee, caster, or siege types.
messages.minions.title: Minions
messages.most-played.title: Most Played
messages.most-popular.title: Most Popular
messages.mountain-drake.description: Mountain Drake grants the slayer’s team additional damage to Baron, Drakes, Turrets, and Inhibitors for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Mountain Drake, new walls appear in the jungle.
messages.mountain-drake.title: Mountain Drake
messages.neutral-monsters.title: Neutral Monsters
messages.ocean-drake.description: Ocean Drake grants the slayer’s team increased health and mana regeneration for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Ocean Drake, new healing plants and enlarged brush for stealthing and stalking appear in the jungle.
messages.ocean-drake.title: Ocean Drake
messages.overview.title: Overview
messages.passive-ability.description: Your champion’s passive ability grants unique bonuses and sometimes requires a condition to be met. Unlike other abilities, it is available at the start of the game and can’t be leveled up.
messages.passive-ability.title: Passive ability
messages.playback.playback-progress.title: Playback Progress
messages.playback.time-remaining-with-time.title: Time remaining: %time%

500 Orange Essence

messages.section.champion-explorer.heading:
Meet Some of
the Champs
messages.section.champion-list.description: With more than 140 champions, you’ll find the perfect match for your playstyle. Master one, or master them all.
messages.section.champion-list.title:
Choose Your
Champion
messages.section.champion-roles.description: Whether you like to dive straight into the fray, support your teammates, or something in between, there’s a spot for you on the Rift.
messages.section.champion-roles.title:
Choose Your
Champion
messages.section.champion-style.description: Make it personal by changing up the look of your favorite champions with skins.
messages.section.champion-style.title:
Slay With
Style
messages.section.download-app.description: Download the League app to stay connected to friends and the latest game and esports news.
messages.section.download-app.title: Take League With You
messages.section.game-modes.title:
Multiple Ways to
Play
messages.section.how-to-play.about.description: League of Legends is a team-based strategy game where two teams of five powerful champions face off to destroy the other’s base. Choose from over 140 champions to make epic plays, secure kills, and take down towers as you battle your way to victory.
messages.section.how-to-play.about.title: What is League of Legends?
messages.section.how-to-play.description: There’s a lot to learn about League, so we’ll start with the essentials. Explore the guide below to get the rundown on the most popular game mode.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.neutrals.desc: In between the lanes is the jungle, where neutral monsters and jungle plants reside. The two most important monsters are Baron Nashor and the Drakes. Killing these units grants unique buffs for your team and can also turn the tide of the game.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.neutrals.title: Take on The Jungle
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.neutrals.topic: Baron Nashor is the most powerful monster in the jungle. Killing Baron grants the slayer’s team bonus attack damage, ability power, empowered recall, and greatly increases the power of nearby minions.
Drakes, or dragons, are powerful monsters that grant unique bonuses depending on the element of the drake your team slays. There are four Elemental Drakes and one Elder Dragon.

Drakes, or Dragons, are powerful monsters that grant unique bonuses and even alter the terrain of the map depending on the element of the drake your team slays. There are four Elemental Drakes ([Infernal](tooltip:infernal-drake), [Cloud](tooltip:cloud-drake), [Mountain](tooltip:mountain-drake), and [Ocean](tooltip:ocean-drake)) and one [Elder Dragon](tooltip:elder-dragon).
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.objectives.des: The Nexus is the heart of both teams’ bases. Destroy the enemy’s Nexus first to win the game.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.objectives.top: Located in the enemy team’s base, the enemy Nexus is just like yours. Destroying the enemy Nexus wins your team the game.
Your Nexus is where [minions](tooltip:minions) spawn. Behind your Nexus is the [Fountain](tooltip:fountain), where you can quickly replenish health and mana and access the [Shop](tooltip:shop).
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.positions.desc: There are five positions that make up the recommended team comp for the game. Each lane lends itself to certain kinds of champions and roles—try them all or lock in to the lane that calls you.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.positions.topi: Bot lane champions are the dynamite of the team. As precious cargo, they need to be protected early on before amassing enough gold and experience to carry the team to victory.
Junglers live for the hunt. Stalking between lanes with stealth and skill, they keep a close eye on the most important neutral monsters and pounce the moment an opponent lets their guard down.
Mid laners are your high burst damage champions who can do it all—solo and as a team. For them, combat is a dangerous dance where they’re always looking for an opportunity to outplay their opponent.
Support champions are team guardians. They help keep teammates alive and primarily focus on setting up kills, protecting their teammate in bot lane until they become stronger.
Champions in top lane are the tough solo fighters of the team. It’s their job to protect their lane and focus on the enemy team’s most powerful members.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.targets.desc: Your team needs to clear at least one lane to get to the enemy Nexus. Blocking your path are defense structures called turrets and inhibitors. Each lane has three turrets and one inhibitor, and each Nexus is guarded by two turrets.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.targets.title: Clear The Path
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.targets.topic-: Each Inhibitor is protected by a Turret. When destroyed, [super minions](tooltip:super-minions) will spawn in that lane for several minutes. Afterward, the Inhibitor will respawn and Super Minions will stop spawning.

Turrets deal damage to enemy minions and champions, and provide limited vision from the [Fog of War](tooltip:fog-of-war) for their team. Attack these structures with minions ahead of you to avoid damage and charge ahead.
messages.section.how-to-play.hud.description: Champions have five core abilities, two special spells, and up to seven items at a time. Figuring out the optimal ability order, summoner spells, and item build for your champion will help you succeed as a team.
messages.section.how-to-play.hud.title: Unlock Your Abilities
messages.section.how-to-play.level.description: Champions get stronger by earning experience to level up and gold to buy more powerful items as the game progresses. Staying on top of these two factors is crucial to overpowering the enemy team and destroying their base.
messages.section.how-to-play.level.earn-experienc: When champions earn a certain amount of experience, they level up and can unlock or strengthen abilities and raise their base stats. Gain experience by killing enemy units and champions, assisting in a kill, and destroying defense structures.
messages.section.how-to-play.level.earn-gold.desc: Gold is the in-game currency to buy items for your champion. Earn gold by killing enemy units and champions, assisting in a kill, destroying defense structures, and equipping gold income items.
messages.section.how-to-play.level.title: Power Up Your Champ
messages.section.how-to-play.reward.description: You’ve got the basics down. Now it’s time to take it day by day—and level by level. Earn rewards when you log in daily (doesn’t have to be consecutive) and when you level up your account.
messages.section.how-to-play.reward.heading:
Start Playing
Earn Rewards
messages.section.how-to-play.title:
Welcome to The Rift
Learn The Basics
messages.section.player-guide.description: New to League? Get a rundown on the basics for the most popular game mode.
messages.section.player-guide.title:
Start Your
Legend
messages.see-other-social-channels.action: Check out our other social channels
messages.share.title: Share
messages.share-this-article.title: Share this article
messages.shop.description: The Shop is where you can buy and sell items with gold you’ve earned. It can only be accessed while you are at the Fountain.
messages.shop.title: Shop
messages.site.nexus.title: Nexus
messages.site.nexus.view-all-news.title: View All Nexus News
messages.skills-and-abilities.title: Skills & Abilities
messages.smite.description: Smite deals instantaneous true damage to monsters and is considered an essential spell for junglers to equip.
messages.smite.title: Smite
messages.social-network.line.title: Line
messages.starter-champions.title: Starter Champions
messages.structures.title: Structures
messages.suggested-lane.title: Suggested Lane
messages.summoner-spells.description: Summoner spells are abilities with unique effects that champions can use. They are mapped to the D and F keys. There are many spells, but a few commonly used ones are [Flash](tooltip:flash), [Teleport](tooltip:teleport), [Smite](tooltip:smite), and [Ignite](tooltip:ignite).
messages.summoner-spells.title: Summoner Spells
messages.super-minions.description: Super minions are more powerful minions with melee range. They can more easily take down enemy minion waves and defense structures.
messages.super-minions.title: Super minions
messages.teleport.description: Teleport can transport your champion to a friendly turret, minion, or ward anywhere on the map after a short delay.
messages.teleport.title: Teleport
messages.trinkets.description: Trinkets are unique items that can be purchased from the Shop for free. They assist in granting vision on the map or sweeping for enemy wards.
messages.trinkets.title: Trinkets
messages.twitter.title: Twitter
messages.youtube.title: YouTube
messages.twitch.title: Twitch
messages.ultimate-ability.description: Your champion’s ultimate ability is mapped to the R key and is available once you reach level 6. Ultimates are considered the most powerful and game-changing abilities.
messages.ultimate-ability.title: Ultimate ability
messages.view-image-x-of-y.action.icu: View image {x, plural, other {#}} of {y, plural, other {#}}
messages.vk.title: VK
messages.puzzle.title: Sentinels of Light
messages.puzzle.stage3.letter:
To the Sentinels—
In the event of my death, I appoint Akshan as my successor, to inherit my weapon and keep Shurima protected from the forces of undeath.
May you one day find us,
Shadya
